company

Class Employee

  • java.lang.Object
    • company.Person
      • company.Employee
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Manager

    public class Employee
extends Person
implements java.io.Serializable
    An employee is the most basic role for a staff member. Every staff member of the company is an employee. The different staff roles are employee, manager and head manager. An employee has to check every working day accordingly to his schedule. An employee can have excess or deficit hours, considered respectively as positive and negative overtime.
    Author:
    Charles MECHERIKI
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public Overtime getOvertime()

      • initializeCheckingAttributes

        public void initializeCheckingAttributes()
        Initializes the previous next expected checking date time and the next expected checking date time. Note : the employee is supposed to start work the next working day after his hiring (i.e his creation).

      • getCheckingByID

        public Checking getCheckingByID(int _checkingID)
                         throws CheckingException
        Returns the checking with the given ID.
        Parameters:
        _checkingID - the id of the checking
        Returns:
        the checking with the given ID
        Throws:
        CheckingException - if no checking has the given ID

      • generateCheckingContext

        public CheckingContext generateCheckingContext(java.time.LocalDateTime _checkingDateTime)
                                        throws CheckingException
        Generates a checking context for the employee at a certain date time. This method determines if the employee was supposed to check at this moment (according to his schedule and previous checkings), and updates its different date time attributes and total overtime.
        Parameters:
        _checkingDateTime - the date time of the checking context
        Returns:
        the checking context generated
        Throws:
        CheckingException - if the employee wasn't supposed to check (i.e during the week-end or after having already checked out)

      • correctCheckingContext

        public void correctCheckingContext(CheckingContext _checkingContext,
                                   java.time.LocalDateTime _correctDateTime)
        Correct the given checking context of the employee, updating all its information accordingly.
        Parameters:
        _checkingContext - the checking context to correct
        _correctDateTime - the correct date time for the checking

      • toCSVLine

        public java.lang.String toCSVLine()
        Returns the CSV line representing the staff member. Only the firstname, lastname, department and role are saved.
        Returns:
        the CSV line representing the staff member.
